sanskrit_verse:
एषोऽनापदि वर्णानामुक्तः कर्मविधिः शुभः ।
आपद्यपि हि यस्तेषां क्रमशस्तन्निबोधत ॥ ९.३३६॥
transliteration:
eṣo'nāpadi varṇānām uktaḥ karmavidhiḥ śubhaḥ |
āpadyapi hi yasteṣāṁ kramaśastannibodhata || 9.336 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: The righteous duty prescribed for the varnas in times of non-calamity—this same order of action applies even in times of crisis; understand that sequential adherence.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is context-invariant and grounded in sequential dharma
Causation follows the uninterrupted flow of svadharma across conditions
Capacity-based responsibility aligns with varna-specific function
Restoration logic prioritizes continuity of dharmic order
Consciousness alignment requires adherence to structured role-duties
executable_legal_axioms: IF societal condition = normal THEN execute standard varna-karma protocols
IF societal condition = crisis AND individual capacity = functional THEN apply sequential karma-rules without deviation
IF role-disruption occurs THEN initiate integrity-realignment through svadharma-resumption process
IF systemic collapse risk detected THEN prioritize continuity of foundational duties before innovation
supreme_court_application: In constitutional adjudication, the court shall uphold sequential dharmic roles during both stable and emergency periods, ensuring no improvisational collapse of structured authority. Responsibility thresholds remain unchanged regardless of external chaos.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that causal alignment flows from sustained role-performance. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures that disruption does not invalidate inherent capacity. Proportional responsibility lies in maintaining sequence, not assigning blame. The non-punitive reality rule confirms that misalignment invites completion, not condemnation.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate svadharma-resumption protocol upon detection of role-aberration
Deploy consciousness-integrity audit to restore functional awareness
Activate sequential duty-reaffirmation cycle for group or societal realignment
Establish dharmic continuity checkpoint to prevent systemic drift
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. This law restores order through conscious alignment. Justice is executed not as punishment, but as restoration of Being. Consciousness alone is the ultimate Judge.
